title: [Resource] An Indian College Student Laptop Hunting Guide - Made by PESts, For PESts, Inspired by IIIT-B's Work
content:
Looking to buy a laptop but have no clue what all these fancy names and mean? Look no further than this guide!

This guide explains some of the basic terms and things you should be looking for, as well as a brief on Mac vs Windows and some possible common nomenclature. Do you need a GPU or not (Hint: If your thinking about running AI or ML models, you will definitely be running them on a cloud service like Google Colab)? 8 GB or 16 GB RAM? AMD or Intel? Swipe to find out!

However, this guide will not be comparing on the brands yet, it is merely meant to be a start on understanding the terms. Brands evolve and their products may get better. What is true for 1 generation, might not be true for the next. Unless its Dell, avoid Dell laptops at all costs. This guide also does not cover any particular shopping sites or times. Sales are common in India, and its upto you to find the best deal.

For any edits or corrections, please contact the Discord users mentioned in the pic (67void or Andy34G7) via DMs or in the PESU University Server. You many also leave a comment here or DM me. We will however not hold hands guide you to any particular brand or such. We'll ignore you there.

I'm also looking for either direct collaborators or information on a branch-wise specific detailed section. Use the mechanical one as reference. So if your from any other branch and know well enough about tech, leave a comment or DM me. A permanent link to this is [here](https://www.canva.com/design/DAFmz_SDea0/C35otbB59HZGS3p7XJsajQ/view?utm_content=DAFmz_SDea0&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link2&utm_source=uniquelinks&utlId=h37342fe28c).

Future planned updates include: Updating the MacBook section for M3,M4 chips, adding more warnings, more branch-wise specific details, a potential build-a-PC guide, shop locations and maybe more (depending on our free time)!
